componenttext: Yes. Yes, we can hear you, Rob. Go ahead.

headline: Keysight Technologies, Inc., Q4 2021 Earnings Call, Nov 22, 2021
componenttextpreview: Okay. I did have a clarification question just on the first quarter guidance. So I guess, Neil, maybe this is directed to you. Is the assumption that margins would be down year-over-year within your guidance? I'm not sure I totally caught your below-the-l
componenttext: Okay. I did have a clarification question just on the first quarter guidance. So I guess, Neil, maybe this is directed to you. Is the assumption that margins would be down year-over-year within your guidance? I'm not sure I totally caught your below-the-line guidance.

headline: Keysight Technologies, Inc., Q4 2021 Earnings Call, Nov 22, 2021
componenttextpreview: Yes. All I said was relative to where we just finished Q4 -- we finished the year at 15.9% R&D investment, it was 1 point lower than that in the fourth quarter. And I think we look and see a tremendous amount of opportunity for us to invest via the R&D li
componenttext:
Yes. All I said was relative to where we just finished Q4 -- we finished the year at 15.9% R&D investment, it was 1 point lower than that in the fourth quarter. And I think we look and see a tremendous amount of opportunity for us to invest via the R&D line to bring new technologies to market. So I think over the course of FY '22, you could expect us to return our R&D spend more into that mid-16% kind of a range, which will obviously have a little bit of a pressure on margins. 
The only other thing I would say is, in Q4, we did have a very favorable product mix within the quarter. At least as we see Q1 taking shape, we expect mix on a sequential basis to be a little bit less favorable. And then there are some normal items for Keysight that also typically impact Q1, most notably that we do company-wide salary administration in the first quarter. And given the inflationary environment that we're in, that is a larger-than-typical salary increase this Q1.

headline: Keysight Technologies, Inc., Q4 2021 Earnings Call, Nov 22, 2021
componenttextpreview: And again, that's compared to Q4, which was a 31% operating margin. That was a very, very high record.
componenttext: And again, that's compared to Q4, which was a 31% operating margin. That was a very, very high record.

headline: Keysight Technologies, Inc., Q4 2021 Earnings Call, Nov 22, 2021
componenttextpreview: Right. Your expectation, within 10% type EPS growth, how would your assumptions around incentive compensation play out on a year-over-year basis?
componenttext: Right. Your expectation, within 10% type EPS growth, how would your assumptions around incentive compensation play out on a year-over-year basis?

headline: Keysight Technologies, Inc., Q4 2021 Earnings Call, Nov 22, 2021
componenttextpreview: Yes. So obviously, there's 2 components to our incentive programs. There's the incentive programs for the broader employee base, which are driven based on the organic growth rate of the company as well as our operating margins. And so those would be the t
componenttext: Yes. So obviously, there's 2 components to our incentive programs. There's the incentive programs for the broader employee base, which are driven based on the organic growth rate of the company as well as our operating margins. And so those would be the true drivers there. I think for the executive population's ability to grow EPS, and this is really cash compensation portion, its ability to grow EPS and grow the top line. And over the longer term, our primary source of variable compensation is based on total shareholder return. And so I think as we look forward to FY '22, we're seeing wages up significantly as a result of kind of the broader inflationary environment, and that's being offset by a decrease in the broader variable pay programs.

headline: Keysight Technologies, Inc., Q4 2021 Earnings Call, Nov 22, 2021
componenttextpreview: Okay. Just a quick follow-up. With respect to your capital allocation plan, could you just give us an update on how you view the M&A pipeline, maybe where your focus would be at this point?
componenttext: Okay. Just a quick follow-up. With respect to your capital allocation plan, could you just give us an update on how you view the M&A pipeline, maybe where your focus would be at this point?

headline: Keysight Technologies, Inc., Q4 2021 Earnings Call, Nov 22, 2021
componenttextpreview: Yes. Absolutely, Ron?
componenttext: Yes. Absolutely, Ron?

headline: Keysight Technologies, Inc., Q4 2021 Earnings Call, Nov 22, 2021
componenttextpreview: Yes. Again, in our target markets, what we're looking to do is provide total solutions. And there's no doubt if there are certain parts or components of a total solution that we need, that would be the first priority. The second thing that we're doing is
componenttext: Yes. Again, in our target markets, what we're looking to do is provide total solutions. And there's no doubt if there are certain parts or components of a total solution that we need, that would be the first priority. The second thing that we're doing is we're expanding into adjacent markets. As Satish had mentioned earlier, we started off in 5G or 4G, mostly on the physical layer, going ahead and providing solutions there. Then we moved up into the protocol layer. And now you can see we're in the application layer and security. So we continue to look for adjacent opportunities also. That is what we're looking at. We have a very robust funnel, but we also have very high hurdles. So we have the ability to not only make the acquisitions that we need to make but also to return cash to the shareholders. And that's why we announced $1.2 billion share buyback program.

headline: Keysight Technologies, Inc., Q4 2021 Earnings Call, Nov 22, 2021
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Rob. Next question comes from the line of Adam Thalhimer of Thompson, Davis.
componenttext: Thank you, Rob. Next question comes from the line of Adam Thalhimer of Thompson, Davis.

headline: Keysight Technologies, Inc., Q4 2021 Earnings Call, Nov 22, 2021
componenttextpreview: Just a quick one on margins. I'm curious how you guys are thinking about operating margin improvement by segment. You had a great year at EISG. I just wonder if that creates a tough comp for you or if you can even build off of the '21 result.
componenttext: Just a quick one on margins. I'm curious how you guys are thinking about operating margin improvement by segment. You had a great year at EISG. I just wonder if that creates a tough comp for you or if you can even build off of the '21 result.

headline: Keysight Technologies, Inc., Q4 2021 Earnings Call, Nov 22, 2021
componenttextpreview: Yes. Certainly, obviously, a very tough comp for EISG given the strong results not just within the quarter where they reached up into the upper 30s, 36%, but for the full year here. I think we have opportunities to increase margins across both segments. I
componenttext: Yes. Certainly, obviously, a very tough comp for EISG given the strong results not just within the quarter where they reached up into the upper 30s, 36%, but for the full year here. I think we have opportunities to increase margins across both segments. I think we have initiatives in place across both segments to increase software content, to increase solutions content and to increase the value added that we're bringing to customers. And so I think if you think about opportunities in EV, in IoT for EISG and, of course, in not just 5G but 6G and quantum and aerospace defense on the CSG side, there's ample market opportunity for us to continue to increase the value add that Keysight brings to our customers. And I think as we do that, that has a chance to be margin accretive across both groups.

headline: Keysight Technologies, Inc., Q4 2021 Earnings Call, Nov 22, 2021
componenttextpreview: Great. Thanks, Adam. So well, that concludes our question-and-answer session for today. I'd like to thank you all for joining us, and we look forward to speaking with many of you at the upcoming conferences. So thanks, again, and have a great day.
componenttext: Great. Thanks, Adam. So well, that concludes our question-and-answer session for today. I'd like to thank you all for joining us, and we look forward to speaking with many of you at the upcoming conferences. So thanks, again, and have a great day.
